newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent untraded, looks lower on profit taking.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent untraded, looks lower on profit taking.

text.p: Brent crude futures prices in Asia were untraded at midday on Tuesday but indicated lower weighed down by continued profit taking on NYMEX.
July NYMEX crude was last traded at $21.80 per barrel, down 10 cents from New York's close.
July Brent was quoted on SIMEX at $20.02/$20.15 per barrel, in line with an arbitrage value of $20.07, brokers said.
However, they said they expected some support for July Brent at $20.01, which represents a 50-percent retracement of the rally on Friday which took prices from a low of $19.43 to a high of $20.60.
"I think we should expect some support around there," one broker said.
He said technically the market remained supported, but needed to hold above Monday's high and Friday's close of $20.35 to indicate further near term strength on the upside.
